title: All Scout Bot Locations In Metroid Prime 4: Beyond
description: By     Jason Rodriguez   on December 10, 2025 at 8:28AM PST                                GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from...
body:
By 
    Jason Rodriguez
   on December 10, 2025 at 8:28AM PST    
          
                  GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                Are you befuddled by the locations of Scout Bots in Metroid Prime 4: Beyond? These derelict machines have been scattered all over the world of Viewros, and some of them are quite hard to find. Still, if you manage to stumble upon these contraptions, then you're in for a treat. That's because they automatically reveal all items and upgrades in a particular zone.Our guide has all the details that you need. But, before we continue, we need to remind you that Scout Bots can only be activated once you've unlocked the Thunder Shot ability several hours into the campaign. Upon zapping a Scout Bot, scan it to mark the remaining items on your map.Fury Green - Scout Bot locationSub-zone: Ancient Path - This machine is in the middle of the clearing next to several red plants.Volt Forge - Scout Bot locationSub-zone: Tower 2 Generator - You're likely to spot this Scout Bot in Metroid Prime 4 while exploring the Volt Forge. Later in the game, once you get the Thunder Shot, you could just take a shortcut to reach it.From the Tower 1 Elevator, use a bomb to activate a lift that allows you to fit if you're in your Morph Ball form.At the Tower 1 Generator area, walk to the opposite edge and scan the purple mist. This reveals a psionic boost rail. Charge your Psychic Boost Ball to quickly travel to Tower 2.The drone is at the opposite end of the Tower 2 Generator platform.Ice Belt - Scout Bot locationSub-zone: Snowfield - This machine is fairly hard to miss. You'll see it as you approach the large open Snowfield, which is also where you end up fighting dozens of wolves. Oh, and don't forget to grab the Shot Expansion in a small nook behind the debris. Use your Fire Shot to melt the ice.Flare Pool - Scout Bot locationSub-zone: Lava Lake Bridge - Upon arriving at the massive lake of scorching hot lava, mount up on your Vi-O-La and go to the opposite end along the right-hand side. The derelict contraption is near some tether points.Great Mines - Scout Bot locationSub-zone: Main Shaft Level 3 - Found just after the last save point before the boss' chamber. When you see the giant Griever cocoon, look to your left near the doorway.Sol Valley - Scout Bot locationSub-zone: N/A - This particular Scout Bot can be found just north of the entrance to Volt Forge. Use your psionic powers to make the purple platforms materialize. Then, hop over to the opposite landmass. Note that this particular Scout Bot reveals various items that are in underground shrines, as well as those that are given to you by Tokabi at his campsites.That does it for our guide on where to find all Scout Bots in Metroid Prime 4: Beyond. These drones ought to make exploration a lot easier since you'll be able to see several goodies on your map. If you need clearer directions, you can take a look at our articles about Energy Tanks, Shot Expansions, Missile Expansions, Psychic Power Bomb Expansions, and Mech Parts.Venture forth across the endless dunes of Viewros and delve deeper into long-forgotten alien facilities. If ever you need help with various facets, you can always visit our Metroid Prime 4: Beyond guides hub.

title: PlayStation Plus Extra/Premium Games For December 2025 Include Assassins And Skateboarders
description: By     Darryn Bonthuys   on December 10, 2025 at 9:35AM PST                                GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from...
body:
By 
    Darryn Bonthuys
   on December 10, 2025 at 9:35AM PST    
          
                  GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                With the festive season in full swing and many people planning to take a well-deserved break, grabbing a few downloads from the PlayStation Plus Game Catalog sounds like a grand idea. For December, the subscription service is adding 10 more games to its library, including the day-one release of Skate Story, Assassin's Creed action with an old-school flavor, and a colorful RPG adventure in the skies.Aside from Skate Story, these will all be available starting December 16. See the full list below. In case you missed it, the December free games for PS Plus subscribers--Lego Horizon Adventures, Killing Floor 3, The Outlast Trials, Synduality Echo of Ada, and Neon White--are also available to claim, so make certain to do so before January 5, 2026.If you're curious to see just how much time you spent playing games this year, you can also check out the 2025 PlayStation Wrap-Up for a breakdown on which games you were focused on.Assassin's Creed Mirage (PS5, PS4)First released in 2023, Assassin's Creed Mirage was billed as a return to the stealth-focused roots of the series. Set in ancient Baghdad, the game follows Basim Ibn Ishaq after he is recruited into the Hidden Ones and joins the fight against the Order of the Ancients.Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty (PS5, PS4)Developed by Team Ninja--the studio behind the Nioh games and co-developer of Ninja Gaiden 4--Wo-Long: Fallen Dynasty is a fast-paced action game with parry-based combat that'll appeal to Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice fans. Set during China's Three Kingdoms period of history, the game puts a dark fantasy and souls-like spin on this era of Chinese history. Skate Story (PS5)A day-one release, Skate Story puts you in control of a demon who makes a deal with the devil to swallow the moon. As if that didn't sound challenging enough, your demonic avatar also happens to be constructed from glass and pain, so any fumble is going to hurt really badly. Not only do you have to master your skateboard, but you also have to use it to overcome other demons, save tormented souls with your sick tricks, and discover the secrets of hell without taking a tumble. Granblue Fantasy: Relink (PS5, PS4)As the captain of a skyfaring crew, you've got free rein to explore the floating archipelago of the Sky Realm in Granblue Fantasy: Relink and find the legendary island of Estalucia. That's easier said than done, as between enemy gangs and a growing plot in the background that threatens the entire Sky Realm, you'll have your work cut out for you in this fantasy game.Planet Coaster 2 (PS5)Looking to become a theme park master? Then you'll want to grab a download of Planet Coaster 2 and start building some attention-grabbing rides. Building on the foundation set by its predecessor, Planet Coaster 2 offers more tools and resources to not only construct exciting water rides and coasters, but also the facilities to keep your park guests happy when they've got their feet firmly planted on the ground. Cat Quest 3 (PS5, PS4)The Cat Quest games are delightful adventures full of terrific puns, and Cat Quest 3 doesn't disappoint. An open-world action-RPG set in a fantastical pirate-themed world known as the Purribean, the threequel sees players search for a long-lost mythical treasure and battle Pi-rats on the high seas. The game is also playable in solo or co-op modes.Lego Horizon Adventures (PS5)We've seen Aloy's debut adventure on PS4 and remastered for PS5, but the Lego version puts a lighthearted spin on a familiar tale. Set in a world where humanity is no longer at the top of the food chain following a robot uprising, Lego Horizon Adventures follows Aloy as she sets out to prove herself and discover the lost secrets of the planet. You can hunt machines as Aloy, or you can play as her allies Varl, Teersa, and Erend in this colorful Lego game. Paw Patrol: Grand Prix (PS5, PS4)For the younger members of the family, you can boot up not one but two Paw Patrol games for them. The first one is a kart-racer featuring the gang, as they compete to win the Pup Cup. Paw Patrol World (PS5, PS4)The second Paw Patrol game is an action-adventure where you can play as the pups. Just like the animated series, you can drive their signature vehicles, engage in rescue missions, and explore Adventure Bay to help out citizens in need. Soulcalibur 3 (PS5, PS4)PlayStation Plus Premium subscription requiredThe timeless tale of swords and souls is back, as Soulcalibur 3 joins the classics library this month. Originally released in 2005 for PS2, Soulcalibur 3 on PS5 and PS4 has been upgraded with enhanced visuals, quick-save and rewind functionality, and custom video filters.

title: One Of The Best Nintendo 64 Platformers Is Coming To Nintendo Switch Online

body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                An absolute classic is one of two Nintendo 64 games set to join the Nintendo Classics library this month. Rayman 2: The Great Escape and Tonic Trouble, both from Ubisoft, will be available to play for Nintendo Switch Online + Expansion Pack subscribers starting December 17.Rayman 2 was originally released in 1999 for Nintendo 64 and PC, with ports on Dreamcast, PlayStation, and other platforms following in subsequent years. It was the first 3D outing for Ubisoft's mascot and received acclaim from critics, rivaling Crash Bandicoot, Banjo-Kazooie, and even Super Mario 64.Tonic Trouble is also an Ubisoft original, though decidedly with a lesser reputation compared to Rayman 2. Designed by Rayman creator Michel Ancel, the action-adventure game depicts a mutated Earth with a ton of colorful and quirky character designs.          GameSpot's Rayman 2: The Great Escape review from 2000 rewarded the title a 9.3 score, citing its "wonderfully humorous story, excellent game mechanics, and perfection in almost all other categories." Meanwhile, Tonic Trouble received a 3/10 review from GameSpot in 1999, with the reviewer lamenting that it will be remembered as "the game that's not Rayman 2."If these Ubisoft additions aren't doing it for you, at least the addition of Rayman 2 bodes well for a couple of first-party Nintendo games making it onto the service. Back in July, online sleuths looked at blurry cover-art images from a Nintendo video and deduced that five then-unannounced additions to Nintendo Classics were coming to the service.Two of those five titles, one being Rayman 2 and the other being Forsaken 64, have made it to Nintendo Switch Online since then, with the remaining games being Glover, Donkey Kong 64, and the original Super Smash Bros. The latter two have been glaring omissions, so Rayman 2's NSO debut should give hope to those waiting for some certified bangers on the service.
